title: Logan Paul claims he has suffered brain damage from sparring for KSI rematch

YouTube star Logan Paul claims he has suffered "brain damage" from his preparations for a rematch with KSI.

Paul is in the middle of an extreme training regime to get ready for his professional debut against his fellow internet sensation on November 9.

They met as amateurs and drew in Manchester last August but will ditch the headguards for the second installment of their high-profile feud.

It is now a different ball game for Paul and KSI as they prepare like professional boxers - and after undertaking gruelling sparring practice, Paul claimed he now understands why boxing goes "hand-in-hand" with brain damage.

(Image: Getty Images)

Speaking on his SnapChat, he said: "Sparring is a fast track to success because you get good quicker. However, it’s dangerous.

“It’s very taxing on the body. You’re getting hit in the head constantly.

"Boxing is a sport that goes hand-to-hand with brain damage. I don’t know if you can tell, but I think I’m already suffering from it."

The dangers of boxing have been highlighted by a number of in-ring deaths this year, including the tragic passing of American Patrick Day, 27, last week as a result of injuries sustained in a bout in Chicago days earlier.

(Image: Getty Images)

Despite knowing the risks he faces next month, Paul says he is in better shape than he was in their first bout as he looks to emerge with a win.

He claims he has been coming out on top against professional fighters, as well as training with heavier gloves to improve his hand speed.

He added: "I got tired last year, but I don’t think anyone can tell me KSI is a better boxer than me. That’s just not facts and I’m a man of facts.

(Image: X90206)

“This year, the conditioning’s improving and the relaxation is improving. That’s why I got tired last year, the adrenaline was rushing.

"I have been practising with heavier gloves so when I put the smaller ones on, I will be like lightning.

"I am sparring professional fighters and I am beating them badly. That does so much for my confidence.

"I relied on my athleticism to carry me through the first fight and it almost worked. But now I am a boxer, I am literally a professional fighter and I feel like it.

"I love the idea of beating up the person who is trying to beat me up."
description: Logan Paul is in the middle of a gruelling training regime before his KSI rematch and says it is taking its toll
